terms.description: A set of protocols for building and interacting with software applications.
Delivery of computing services over the internet for storage, processing, and management.
A branch of artificial intelligence that enables systems to learn from data.
Practices and technologies designed to protect systems, networks, and data from cyber threats.
An organized collection of data, typically stored and accessed electronically.
A network security system that monitors and controls incoming and outgoing traffic.
The creation of virtual versions of physical hardware or software resources.
A set of practices that combine software development and IT operations for faster delivery.
An incident where unauthorized access to confidential data occurs.
A simulated cyber attack to identify vulnerabilities in a system or network.
A set of rules for solving a problem or completing a task.
The server-side part of a web application responsible for data processing and storage.
The part of a web application that users interact with directly.
A centralized repository for storing and analyzing large volumes of structured data.
A device that distributes network traffic across multiple servers.
The process of converting information into a code to prevent unauthorized access.
A subset of AI that enables systems to learn from data.
Software with source code that anyone can inspect, modify, and enhance.
The means by which users interact with a computer or application.
The overall experience a user has when interacting with a product or service.
A methodology for software development that emphasizes iterative progress and collaboration.
The approach taken to prepare for, detect, and respond to cybersecurity incidents.
A service that encrypts your internet connection for privacy and security.
An agile framework for managing complex projects through iterative progress.
A practice that integrates security into the DevOps process.
An architectural style that structures an application as a collection of small, loosely coupled services.
The integration of digital technology into all areas of a business.
The ability of different systems to work together and share information effectively.
The use of software robots to automate repetitive tasks.
Large and complex datasets that traditional data processing applications cannot handle.
The process of creating copies of data to protect against loss.
Software as a Service, delivering applications over the internet on a subscription basis.
Function as a Service, allowing users to run individual functions in the cloud.
The delay between a request for data and the response received.
Replacing sensitive data with non-sensitive equivalents or tokens.
A discipline that incorporates aspects of software engineering to improve system reliability.
Software that enables users to create and manage digital content.
The process of identifying and responding to incidents to minimize impact.
The process of ensuring that a product meets specified requirements and standards.
Software programmed into hardware devices to control their functions.
The arrangement of different elements in a computer network.
The process of analyzing large datasets to discover patterns and trends.
A version control system for tracking changes in code during software development.
A mathematical scheme for verifying the authenticity and integrity of a message.
The simulation of human intelligence in machines designed to think and learn.
The maximum data transfer rate of a network or internet connection.
A framework for building responsive websites and applications using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
An AI program that simulates conversation with users through text or voice.
A practice where code changes are automatically tested and integrated into a shared repository.
The management of data availability, usability, integrity, and security in an organization.
The field that uses scientific methods, processes, and algorithms to extract insights from structured and unstructured data.
The process of restoring IT systems and operations after a disruptive event.
Processing data near the source of data generation to reduce latency.
A web-based platform for version control and collaborative software development using Git.
An individual who uses programming skills to gain unauthorized access to systems or networks.
A computing environment that combines private and public cloud services.
The practice of protecting information from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, or destruction.
Managing and provisioning computing infrastructure through machine-readable definition files.
The network of interconnected devices that collect and exchange data.
A type of performance testing to evaluate how a system behaves under expected load.
Software that connects different applications or services, enabling them to communicate.
A field of AI focused on the interaction between computers and human language.
Software and hardware that are located on the physical premises of an organization.
A fraudulent attempt to obtain sensitive information by disguising as a trustworthy entity.
Cloud computing resources used exclusively by one organization.
Cloud services offered over the public internet and available to anyone who wants to purchase them.
The process of ensuring that products meet certain standards of quality.
The inclusion of extra components to ensure system reliability in case of failure.
A process for planning, creating, testing, and deploying software.
The practice of tracking and managing changes to software code.
A standard programming language for managing and manipulating relational databases.
The examination of code without executing it to identify potential errors.
An architecture where the cloud provider manages the server infrastructure.
The automated collection and transmission of data from remote sources.
The amount of data processed by a system in a given amount of time.
A method for authenticating users by issuing tokens for accessing services.
The process of enhancing user satisfaction by improving usability and accessibility.
Software that helps manage changes to source code over time.
A linear project management methodology where each phase must be completed before the next begins.
A software application that runs on a web server and is accessed through a web browser.
A software vulnerability that is unknown to the vendor and has no available patch.
A computing system inspired by biological neural networks, used in machine learning.
A subset of machine learning that uses neural networks with many layers to analyze data.
The process of managing and maintaining server hardware and software.
A storage repository that holds vast amounts of raw data in its native format.
A network of servers that delivers web content to users based on their geographic location.
The practice of protecting applications from threats throughout their lifecycle.
The process of recording and tracking incidents for resolution and analysis.
